Hero.name: Daniel Vergara Echeverri
Hero.description: A web developer for 10 years, I discovered my passion for programming at university and fully invested in it. Specializing in Frontend with Angular, React and Vue.js, my curiosity also led me to explore other technologies like Node.js, MongoDB, Python, C#, AWS or Docker, both in business and as an autodidact.

description.description1: React and NextJS developer of web applications using technologies such as Redux and Tailwind.
description.description2: Design of interactive modules using React, Typescript, and OpenLayers to integrate map layers, precise georeferencing, and satellite data visualization.
description.description3: Developing serverless applications on AWS, using AppSync to expose GraphQL APIs and DynamoDB as the database.

description.description1: JavaScript developer of web applications using technologies such as NodeJs, VueJs, Webpack, and Storybook.
description.description2: Python developer focused on application development using Jupyter Lab as a foundation.
description.description3: Leader of a study group focused on learning AWS.

description.description1: FE Technical Leader in Web Application Development using Angular 7, RxJs, NgRx.
description.description2: Developer of several web applications using Angular 4-6, RxJs, NgRx, Sass and functional and reactive programming.
description.description3: Participation in international client development teams using agile methodologies such as SCRUM.

description.description1: Fullstack Developer in Larnia application using technologies like ASP.NET MVC, SQL and ReactJS.
description.description2: There was support for the customer in defining the guidelines and also support for the Azure infrastructure.
description.description3: C# and .Net developer of devops solutions for Windows.

description.description1: Developer in several PHP applications in the medical, administrative and real estate fields using PHP5, Laravel, JQuery technologies
description.description2: Worked in projects using MEAN Stack, MongoDB, AngularJs et Sails.js.
